data.title: How to reach Juliet ?
data.statement:
Romeo wants to launch a paper plane with a love letter to Juliet, but he can't see where her house is from his launch pad. Hopefully, his friends are on roofs and can see each others, creating a chain to Juliet's house.

Using the heading and distance between friends, calculate the heading and distance from Romeo to Juliet's house, rounded to a integer.
The last friend is on the roof of Juliet's house.

<<Example>>
If the inputs are
10 3
30 4
-15 8
that means
• Romeo is able to see the roof of Friend 1's house at 10 degrees at a distance of 3 units.
• Friend 1 is able to see the roof of Friend 2's house at 30 degrees at a distance of 4 units.
• Friend 2 is able to see the roof of Juliet's house at -15 degrees at a distance of 8 units.

The result must be rounded to an integer

<<Hints:>>
You may calculate the difference in coordinate (dx,dy) between two points using their angle and distance 
- dx=sin(Angle)xDistance
- dy=cos(Angle)xDistance

You may calculate the Angle of a point using Angle=atan(x/y)

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

Romeo wants to launch a paper plane with a love letter to Juliet, but he can't see where her house is from his launch pad. Hopefully, his friends are on roofs and can see each others, creating a chain to Juliet's house.

Using the heading and distance between friends, calculate the heading and distance from Romeo to Juliet's house, rounded to a integer.
The last friend is on the roof of Juliet's house.

Example
If the inputs are
10 3
30 4
-15 8
that means
• Romeo is able to see the roof of Friend 1's house at 10 degrees at a distance of 3 units.
• Friend 1 is able to see the roof of Friend 2's house at 30 degrees at a distance of 4 units.
• Friend 2 is able to see the roof of Juliet's house at -15 degrees at a distance of 8 units.

The result must be rounded to an integer

Hints:
You may calculate the difference in coordinate (dx,dy) between two points using their angle and distance
- dx=sin(Angle)xDistance
- dy=cos(Angle)xDistance

You may calculate the Angle of a point using Angle=atan(x/y)
Input
Line 1: A integer N for the number of headings and distances between Romeo, his friends and Juliet's house
Next N lines: Two space separated integer : H for the heading in degree, D for the distance in arbitrary unit
Output
Line 1 : The heading and distance from Romeo to Juliet's house in rounded integers
Constraints
1 ≤ N ≤ 10
-90 < H < 90
1 ≤ D ≤ 10
Example
Input
2
45 7
-30 4
Output
19 9
